image.altText: A woman walks towards a dry river bed.

props.synopsis: Bridging the gap between scientific monitoring and cultural knowledge, traditional owners say persistent pools along WA's longest river are changing with dire consequences.

title.children: 'I got the gift of it': 'Rainmaker' sounds the alarm as Western Australia's longest river runs dry

image.altText: A man stands posing for a photo on a wooden walkway in front of trees, wearing a white shirt and dark pants.

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old Perth man charged with the manslaughter of his partner's 11-year-old son after allegedly neglecting him a decade earlier will remain behind bars until later this month.

title.children: Man faces court charged with boy's manslaughter after allegedly leaving him severely disabled as a baby

image.altText: A rainbow on a beach

props.synopsis: The West Australian government says its planned new marine park will be world-class. But among locals, opinion is split on whether it will deliver a promised tourism windfall.

title.children: This new marine park has been compared to the Great Barrier Reef and Ningaloo. But will it bring tourists?

image.altText: A woman sitting in her seat in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: The federal seat of North Sydney is set to be scrapped under new draft boundaries proposed by the Australian Electoral Commission.

title.children: 'This has never been about me': MP Kylea Tink speaks after her electorate slated for abolition

image.altText: Cate Campbell with her eyes closed after missing the 100m freestyle final at the Australian Olympic trials.

props.synopsis: In one of the highest-quality 100m freestyle fields in Australian swimming history, four-time Olympic gold medallist Cate Campbell misses out on making the final by just 0.01 seconds.

title.children: Cate Campbell the biggest casualty ahead of high-quality 100m freestyle final

image.altText: A hand wearing a blue rubber glove holding a small tin full of pouches.

props.synopsis: Nicotine pouches are illegal in Australia, but they've been seized in alarming quantities since the federal government's ban on single-use vapes. Here's why the small sachets have authorities worried.

title.children: Are nicotine pouches the next vape? Authorities warn Australia is being flooded with them

image.altText: White airliner aircraft with red tail against blue sky

props.synopsis: Travel is a hot-button issue in the AFL this season, with both WA sides doing what they can to mitigate the burden. Now a researcher, embedded with Super Rugby side the Western Force, explains just how draining the flights can be.

title.children: Some have said the travel factor for WA sporting teams is overstated. This researcher says otherwise

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Deliberations in the murder trial of Greg Lynn, accused of killing two Victorian campers, will begin next week.

title.children: 'One narrow path to unanimous' guilty verdicts in Greg Lynn trial, jurors told

image.altText: Supreme Court justices sitting and standing in black robes in official portrait.

props.synopsis: For the first time since his supporters stormed the Capitol on January 6, Donald Trump returned to meet Republican politicians. The Supreme Court had just given them something to talk about.

title.children: America's Supreme Court just took some heat out of a fight that could have been hard for Trump to win

image.altText: The artist Guy Warren, a man in his late 90s with a apron on and arms crossed, sitting in his studio

props.synopsis: The "trailblazing" Australian artist — who won the Archibald in 1985 — had a career spanning more than 80 years and was painting right up until he died.

title.children: Trailblazing artist Guy Warren dies aged 103, he only stopped painting three weeks ago

image.altText: In Inside Out 2, Riley's emotions face the biggest challenge of them all: Puberty.

props.synopsis: Pixar president Jim Morris confirmed in May that the studio would be focusing more on IP expansion than original storytelling. It shows with Inside Out 2.

title.children: Pixar has announced it will be focusing on sequels. Inside Out 2 is proof that's not a great idea

image.altText: Robbie Katter holds a "condemn Hamas" sign at pro-Palestine protest in front of Queensland Parliament.

props.synopsis: Ethics Committee chair Stirling Hinchliffe told the House that the two north Queensland-based members had engaged in disorderly conduct during the fiery exchange.

title.children: Katter's Australian Party MPs found in contempt of Queensland parliament over clash with pro-Palestinian protesters

image.altText: An elderly woman wearing a red shirt smiling and a dog being held by its owner

props.synopsis: The NSW deputy coroner has recommended an overhaul of punishments for non-compliant dog owners in her findings following an inquest into the death of a 90-year-old Shoalhaven woman.

title.children: Death of 90-year-old volunteer in savage dog attack was preventable, coroner finds

image.altText: A photo of cocaine bags in a black safe with a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: Packages of cocaine and methamphetamine hidden in air cargo have been monitored by crime squad detectives and led to the arrest of three men in the Northern Territory.

title.children: 'This is not over': $7m bust allegedly disrupts large-scale international drug cartel

image.altText: a teenager approaches Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel 150424 at wakeley

props.synopsis: A teenager charged with a terror offence over the alleged stabbing of a bishop at a south-west Sydney church is charged with additional offences.

title.children: Teen accused of Sydney terror attack hit with new charges as more riot arrests made

image.altText: Forest Claudette wears a see-through blouse, make-up and pearl headpiece against black backdrop

props.synopsis: "I wrote the chorus and f***ing cried". Forest Claudette talks coming out, musical influences, and the Oscar-winning film that inspired their new single.

title.children: Forest Claudette struggled with teen queerness. Now they're the ARIA winning answer to Frank Ocean

image.altText: two elderly indigenous men sit at the front porch of the aged care home

props.synopsis: Halls Creek's aged care home serves a vast area with many Indigenous cultural groups, and now a local Aboriginal health service hopes to boost the facility that's struggled in recent years with compliance breaches.

title.children: Indigenous health service takes over outback town's aged care home after compliance breaches and staffing issues

image.altText: A middle aged man with a mustache wearing a striped shirt and tie smiles at the camera. A persons face is blurred to his right.

props.synopsis: A judge in Townsville said Leonard John Farren's offending encouraged the "abhorrent sexual exploitation of young, vulnerable girls" when sentencing him to five-and-a-half years' jail.

title.children: Teacher who made plans to sedate and abuse 11yo girl jailed for child exploitation crimes

image.altText: fog and cars

props.synopsis: WA farmers impacted by the proposed ban will have their say in Northam today, after a Canberra hearing heard from animal activists and industry leaders earlier this week.

title.children: Politicians warned to expect anger as live sheep export hearing begins in WA

image.altText: A person wearing cultural clothing including colorful robes, headwear and a mask performs a dance.

props.synopsis: The first Batik Air flight from Canberra to Denpasar has taken off, but the airline said there have already been some "teething problems", with two future flights cancelled.

title.children: First flights from Canberra to Bali take off, but not without 'teething problems'

image.altText: An overturned car set alight in front of a parliament building during riots in Argentina's capital

props.synopsis: Argentina's president claims victory after managing to pass his new reforms through the Senate, while demonstrators and police clash outside.

title.children: Riots in Argentina as president narrowly wins vote on radical economic reforms

image.altText: Street view with houses and tropical plants.

props.synopsis: The Townsville woman had been employed at the Tully business for about six years and has been charged with about 120 fraud-related offences.

title.children: Office manager charged over allegedly defrauding business of more than $2.5 million

image.altText: A man smiles after a harness race.

props.synopsis: Robbie Walters was granted permission to train horses in Tasmania under his Victorian licence just a month after admitting to submitting falsified documents to the Office of Racing Integrity.

title.children: Harness trainer was granted permission to train horses in Tasmania – despite recent drug and forgery offences

image.altText: Man sits in driver's seat.

props.synopsis: Shareholders also approved a proposal to re-elect his brother, Kimbal Musk, and son of media mogul Rupert Murdoch, James Murdoch, as board members.

title.children: Billionaire Elon Musk's record-breaking $US56 billion pay package approved by Tesla shareholders

image.altText: Adélie penguins in Antarctica on top of an iceberg

props.synopsis: Climate scientists use Antarctic sea ice to look at Australian weather patterns dating back thousands of years, finding bushfire weather equal to or worse than the 2019 Black Summer has occurred before.

title.children: Buried in Antarctic ice is a warning that Australia could again face bushfires akin to Black Summer

image.altText: Side by side photos of business logos for accounting firms Deloitte, PwC, KPMG and EY

props.synopsis: Australia's share market is trading down on Friday, despite the S&P500 and Nasdaq closing on fresh record highs in the US overnight. Follow the latest in the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Up to 250 jobs going at KPMG, ASX awaits next week's RBA decision, as Japan keeps rates at 0%

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASIC calls for extra cash to manage 'explosion' of digital information
Should we expect to see more job losses this year?

image.altText: A white, middle-aged man with a sandy hair and beard stands with his arms crossed in a timber-panelled room

props.synopsis: The Irish author joins ABC RN's Big Weekend of Books to discuss his wildly popular novel, which was shortlisted for the Booker Prize in 2023.

title.children: If you've read The Bee Sting by Paul Murray, chances are you've Googled the ending

image.altText: Two boys holding up uniform polo shirts with a bunch of shirts on a rack behind them.

props.synopsis: When Newcastle's Belair Public School introduced a new uniform, it didn't want the old ones to end up in landfill. A plan was hatched to recycle them, and also help a remote Fijian community, cyclonic conditions and all.

title.children: It's estimated each school discards at least 100kg of uniforms a year. Here's what this school did with theirs

image.altText: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy shake hands with US President Joe Biden.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed the 10-year deal in a spate of G7 actions intended to deter Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title.children: Biden and Zelenskyy sign 'historic' deal to aid Ukraine's military

image.altText: A black fly-like insect, a stingless bee, pollinating the yellow stamen of a bright orange long-petalled flower.

props.synopsis: Whether you're interested in the sweet benefits of backyard beekeeping or making your home more appealing to solitary species of native bees, what can you do to attract them to your garden?

title.children: How to attract native bees to your garden and why you should

image.altText: close up image of a woman changing a baby's nappy

props.synopsis: Some readers expressed relief and validation to discover the behaviour of avoiding certain tasks or responsibility in the home had a name, while others felt it was more a matter of playing to our strengths in a relationship.

title.children: 'My ex pretended he couldn't pack a dishwasher': Readers share experiences with weaponised incompetence

image.altText: A photo collage

props.synopsis: One photojournalist follows the lives of Warumungu traditional owners in Jurnkkurakurr (Tennant Creek) as they detail their ambitious way out of a centuries-long housing crisis.

title.children: Overcrowding and 'heat caves' plague these communities. They're now bringing home back to Country

image.altText: Hollywood actor Henry Winkler in a green jacket with three firefighters in front of a Dublin Fire Brigade truck.

props.synopsis: Irish fire crews who raced to reports of an emergency at a Dublin hotel were surprised to find Happy Days star Henry Winkler among the chaos outside.

title.children: Henry Winkler describes 'amazing adventure' of fire evacuation in Dublin
